entity.Name: Account

Description.description: Person with whom a business unit has a relationship, such as customer, supplier, and colleague.
Drop-down list for selecting the category of the counterparty.
Select a category to indicate whether the customer counterparty is standard or preferred.
Drop-down list for classifying an counterparty.
Select a classification code to indicate the potential value of the customer counterparty based on the projected return on investment, cooperation level, sales cycle length or other criteria.
Unique identifier of the counterparty.
Type an ID number or code for the counterparty to quickly search and identify the counterparty in system views.
Drop-down list for selecting counterparty ratings.
Select a rating to indicate the value of the customer counterparty.
Type the name of the main contact at the counterparty's primary address.
Type the name of the main contact at the counterparty's secondary address.
Type of business associated with the counterparty.
Select the legal designation or other business type of the counterparty for contracts or reporting purposes.
Type the credit limit of the counterparty. This is a useful reference when you address invoice and accounting issues with the customer.
Information about whether credit for the counterparty is on hold.
Select whether the credit for the counterparty is on hold. This is a useful reference while addressing the invoice and accounting issues with the customer.
Size of the counterparty.
Select the size category or range of the counterparty for segmentation and reporting purposes.
Type of the counterparty.
Select the category that best describes the relationship between the counterparty and your organization.
Choose the default price list associated with the counterparty to make sure the correct product prices for this customer are applied in sales opportunities, quotes, and orders.
Type additional information to describe the counterparty, such as an excerpt from the company's website.
Information about whether to allow sending direct email to the counterparty.
Select whether the counterparty allows bulk email sent through campaigns. If Do Not Allow is selected, the counterparty can be added to marketing lists, but is excluded from email.
Information about whether to allow sending bulk-rate postal mail to the counterparty.

Select whether the counterparty allows bulk postal mail sent through marketing campaigns or quick campaigns. If Do Not Allow is selected, the counterparty can be added to marketing lists, but will be excluded from the postal mail.
Information about whether to allow sending email to the counterparty.
Select whether the counterparty allows direct email sent from Microsoft Dynamics 365.
Information about whether to allow sending faxes to the counterparty.
Select whether the counterparty allows faxes. If Do Not Allow is selected, the counterparty will be excluded from fax activities distributed in marketing campaigns.
Information about whether to allow phone calls to the counterparty.
Select whether the counterparty allows phone calls. If Do Not Allow is selected, the counterparty will be excluded from phone call activities distributed in marketing campaigns.
Information about whether to allow sending postal mail to the counterparty.
Select whether the counterparty allows direct mail. If Do Not Allow is selected, the counterparty will be excluded from letter activities distributed in marketing campaigns.
Information on whether to allow sending marketing mail to the counterparty.
Select whether the counterparty accepts marketing materials, such as brochures or catalogs.
Type the primary email address for the counterparty.
Type the secondary email address for the counterparty.
Type an alternate email address for the counterparty.
Type the fax number for the counterparty.
Select whether the counterparty allows tracking email activities sent from Microsoft Dynamics 365. If Do Not Allow is selected, Microsoft Dynamics 365 will not track the email.
Information about whether to allow following email activity like opens, attachment views and link clicks for emails sent to the counterparty.
Type the URL for the counterparty's FTP site to enable users to access data and share documents.
Type of industry with which the counterparty is associated.

label.description: Agriculture and Non-petrol Natural Resource Extraction

Description.description: Select the counterparty's primary industry for use in marketing segmentation and demographic analysis.
Shows the date when the counterparty was last included in a marketing campaign or quick campaign.
Type the market capitalization of the counterparty to identify the company's equity, used as an indicator in financial performance analysis.
Shows the master counterparty that the counterparty was merged with.
Information regarding whether the counterparty has been merged with a master counterparty.
Shows whether the counterparty has been merged with another counterparty.

displayname.description: รหัสเซ็กเมนต์

Jedinečný identifikátor segmentu přidruženého k account
Identificador único del segmento asociado a account.
Jedinstveni identifikator za segment povezan s account.

Jedinstveni identifikator segmenta povezanog sa account.
Уникальный идентификатор сегмента, связанного с account.
与 account 关联的客户细分的唯一标识符。
account ile ilişkili Segmentin benzersiz tanımlayıcısı.
Olemiga account seostatud segmendi ainuidentifikaator.
Mã định danh duy nhất cho Phân khúc được liên kết với account.
Унікальний ідентифікатор сегмента, пов’язаного з account.
Unik identifierare för segmentet som är associerat med account.
account entitatearekin erlazionatutako segmentuaren identifikatzaile esklusiboa.
account से संबद्ध अनुभाग के लिए युनीक आइडेंटिफ़ायर.
Јединствени идентификатор сегмента повезаног са account.
Pengidentifikasi unik untuk Segmen yang terkait dengan account.
Unieke id van het segment dat is gekoppeld aan de account.
Μοναδικό αναγνωριστικό για το τμήμα που σχετίζεται με account.
Identificador único do segmento asociado ao account.
與 account 相關聯之客戶細分的唯一識別碼。
Identificatore univoco del segmento associato a account.
account нысанымен байланысты сегменттің бір мәнді идентификаторы.
المعرف الفريد للشريحة المقترنة بـ account.

Jednoznačný identifikátor segmentu priradeného k entite account.
Identificador exclusivo do Segmento associado a account.
Ar account saistītā segmenta unikālais identifikators.
Kohteeseen account liittyvän segmentin yksilöivä tunnus.
Identificador exclusivo do segmento associado ao account.
account에 연결된 세그먼트의 고유 식별자.
Unik identifikator for segmentet som er knyttet til account.
Unikatowy identyfikator segmentu skojarzonego z encją account.
與 account 相關聯之客戶細分的唯一識別碼。
Identificateur unique du segment associé à account.
รหัสเฉพาะของเซ็กเมนต์ที่เชื่อมโยงกับ account
Entydigt id for det segment, der er tilknyttet account.
Pengecam unik untuk Segmen yang dikaitkan dengan account.
A következőhöz társított szegmens egyedi azonosítója: account.
Su account susieto segmento unikalusis identifikatorius.
account に関連付けられたセグメントを表す一意識別子です。
המזהה הייחודי של הפלח המשויך ל- account.
Identificatorul unic al segmentului asociat cu account.
Еднозначен идентификатор на сегмента, свързан с account.
Indicates whether this counterparty belongs to hotel group
Type the company or business name.
Type the number of employees that work at the counterparty for use in marketing segmentation and demographic analysis.
Number of open opportunities against an counterparty and its child counterparties.
Sum of open revenue against an counterparty and its child counterparties.

Shows the lead that the counterparty was created from if the counterparty was created by converting a lead in Microsoft Dynamics 365. This is used to relate the counterparty to data on the originating lead for use in reporting and analytics.
Type of company ownership, such as public or private.
Select the counterparty's ownership structure, such as public or private.
Unique identifier of the team who owns the counterparty.
Unique identifier of the user who owns the counterparty.
Choose the parent counterparty associated with this counterparty to show parent and child businesses in reporting and analytics.
Information that specifies whether the counterparty participates in workflow rules.
For system use only. Legacy Microsoft Dynamics CRM 3.0 workflow data.
Payment terms for the counterparty.
Select the payment terms to indicate when the customer needs to pay the total amount.
Day of the week that the counterparty prefers for scheduling service activities.
Select the preferred day of the week for service appointments.
Time of day that the counterparty prefers for scheduling service activities.
Select the preferred time of day for service appointments.
Preferred contact method for the counterparty.
Select the preferred method of contact.
Choose the counterparty's preferred service facility or equipment to make sure services are scheduled correctly for the customer.
Choose the counterparty's preferred service for reference when you schedule service activities.
Choose the preferred service representative for reference when you schedule service activities for the counterparty.
Choose the primary contact for the counterparty to provide quick access to contact details.
Primary Satori ID for Counterparty
Primary Twitter ID for Counterparty
Type the annual revenue for the counterparty, used as an indicator in financial performance analysis.
Type the number of shares available to the public for the counterparty. This number is used as an indicator in financial performance analysis.
Method of shipment for the counterparty.
Select a shipping method for deliveries sent to the counterparty's address to designate the preferred carrier or other delivery option.
Type the Standard Industrial Classification (SIC) code that indicates the counterparty's primary industry of business, for use in marketing segmentation and demographic analysis.
Choose the service level agreement (SLA) that you want to apply to the Counterparty record.
Status of the counterparty.
Shows whether the counterparty is active or inactive. Inactive counterparties are read-only and can't be edited unless they are reactivated.
Reason for the status of the counterparty.
Select the counterparty's status.
Type the stock exchange at which the counterparty is listed to track their stock and financial performance of the company.
Type the main phone number for this counterparty.
Type a second phone number for this counterparty.
Type a third phone number for this counterparty.
Territory to which the counterparty belongs.
Select a region or territory for the counterparty for use in segmentation and analysis.
Choose the sales region or territory for the counterparty to make sure the counterparty is assigned to the correct representative and for use in segmentation and analysis.

Type the stock exchange symbol for the counterparty to track financial performance of the company. You can click the code entered in this field to access the latest trading information from MSN Money.
Total time spent for emails (read and write) and meetings by me in relation to counterparty record.
Type the counterparty's website URL to get quick details about the company profile.
Type the phonetic spelling of the company name, if specified in Japanese, to make sure the name is pronounced correctly in phone calls and other communications.

entity.MobileOfflineFilters: <fetch version="1.0" output-format="xml-platform" mapping="logical" distinct="false"> <entity name="account"> <filter type="and"> <condition attribute="modifiedon" operator="last-x-days" value="10"/> </filter> </entity> </fetch>

Strings.String: You must select a customer. The customer can be a counterparty or a contact.
This search returns results grouped by categories, such as by counterparties, contacts, or leads.
Provide customer service through cases, handle contracts, and create articles in the knowledge base. Work with counterparties, contacts, and products.
Work with counterparties and contacts from the Workplace.
If the {0} has salespeople or counterparties associated with it, the deletion will not succeed.
This counterparty, contact, or lead has refused communication of this type.
This counterparty, contact, or lead is currently in an Inactive state.
The email address for the counterparty, contact, or lead is missing. No activity could be created for it.
The requested counterparty does not exist.
A parent counterparty or parent contact is present.
An opportunity can be associated with only one counterparty.
Lead One Counterparty Error
The counterparty has child opportunities.
Missing Counterparty ID
The counterparty is missing for the current contract.

The price list cannot be deactivated because it is used by an counterparty or a product as the default price list. You must change the default price lists in those records before deactivating this price list.
The specified contact doesn't belong to the counterparty selected as the customer. Specify a contact that belongs to the selected counterparty, and then try again.

You cannot set up duplicate relationships between an opportunity and a customer. For example, if you create a relationship between an opportunity and the counterparty Fabrikam, Inc., and the customer's relationship role is set to Distributor, you cannot create a new relationship for the opportunity that uses the same customer and relationship role.
Specify the counterparty to use to run the report.
Counterparty Manager
Sub-Counterparties
Locate a prospect or potential sales opportunity. Convert qualified leads into counterparties, contacts, and opportunities.
Create a quote, order, or opportunity for an counterparty or contact
Select a counterparty or contact

Create and manage marketing lists and design campaigns. Track planning tasks, campaign activities, and campaign responses. Create and view quick campaigns. Manage sales literature. Work with leads, counterparties, contacts, and products.
Create a new record, such as a contact, counterparty, or lead.

Create a new relationship between this counterparty and another counterparty or contact.

Use this to track a parent or child counterparty of this counterparty, or contacts that work at this counterparty.
Create a new opportunity for this counterparty.

Create a new relationship between this contact and another contact or counterparty.

Use this to track contacts that work together or link this contact and the counterparty it works with.
Create a new relationship between this contact and another contact or counterparty.

Create a relationship between this Opportunity and an opportunity, counterparty, or contact.

Associating this Opportunity with another record makes it easier to keep related information connected, such as which counterparties currently have opportunities.
Perform this action for all counterparties on all pages.
Perform this action for all the Counterparty on the current page.

Create a new relationship between this counterparty and another counterparty or contact.

Use this to track a parent or child counterparty of this counterparty, or contacts that work at this counterparty.
Create a new opportunity for this counterparty.
Select the records, such as contacts or counterparties, that this activity impacts.

Create a new relationship between this contact and another contact or counterparty.

Use this to track contacts that work together or link this contact and the counterparty it works with.
Perform this action for all Counterparty.
Perform this action for all the Counterparty on the current page.

Add a new activity related to this record.

Related activities are things such as letters or email messages that you send to a counterparty or contact.

Create a new opportunity, a counterparty, or a contact with information from this lead,or disqualify the lead and close it.

When the lead is converted, it is saved as qualified or disqualified in the Closed Leads view.
Create records to track potential revenue-generating sales for a counterparty or contact while performing the necessary tracking from the beginning of the sales process through completion.
Remove the most recently used form settings for the counterparty, case, contact, lead, and opportunity entities for every user in your organization.
Dynamics 365 Counterparties
Add your Microsoft Outlook contacts to Microsoft Dynamics 365 and link them to Microsoft Dynamics 365 counterparty records.
Counterparty
The Outlook contact form displays the linked counterparty in the Company field.
Set Counterparty
Pick Existing Counterparty...
{0} Counterparties
Existing Counterparty?
Select the lead from which this counterparty originated. Once the record is saved, the originating lead cannot be changed.

A parent counterparty represents the main company, and sub-counterparties represent company divisions or subsidiaries. If this counterparty is a sub-counterparty, set up a relationship to its parent counterparty. If this counterparty is a parent counterparty, leave this field blank.
Select the facility or equipment preferred most by this counterparty.
Select the service preferred most by this counterparty.
Select the user this counterparty prefers to have services provided by.
You can associate multiple contacts with an counterparty, but only one contact can be designated as the primary contact.
If this appointment is regarding a specific record, such as a counterparty or contact, you can select the record.
Select the existing counterparty, contact, or lead that responded to the campaign.
Select the existing counterparty or contact your organization used for the campaign.
This customer will be either the counterparty or contact associated with this invoice. The Customer column appears in the Invoices list in the Sales pane.
This customer will be either the counterparty or contact associated with this opportunity. The Potential Customer column appears in the Opportunities list in the Sales pane.
This customer will be either the counterparty or contact associated with this quote. The Potential Customer column appears in the Quotes list in the Sales pane.
If this recurring appointment is regarding a specific record, such as a counterparty or contact, you can select the record.
This customer will be either the counterparty or contact associated with this order. The Customer column appears in the Orders list in the Sales pane.
If this service activity is for a specific customer, select the counterparty or contact from the filtered list.
To see whether the customer prefers a specific day of the week, select Days from the Form Assistant list. Preferences are stored on the Administration tab in counterparty and contact records.
To see whether the customer prefers a specific time of day, select Times from the Form Assistant list. Preferences are stored on the Administration tab in counterparty and contact records.
To see whether the customer prefers a specific service, select Service from the Form Assistant list. Preferences are stored on the Administration tab in counterparty and contact records.
Manage the standard labels users can apply when they define relationship roles between counterparties, contacts, and opportunities.
Sub-Counterparty

Create a relationship between this {0} and an opportunity, counterparty, or contact.

Associating this {0} with another record makes it easier to keep related information connected, such as which counterparties currently have opportunities.

Create a new opportunity with a counterparty or a contact using information from this lead.

When the lead is converted, it is saved as qualified in the Closed Leads view.

Work with leads, opportunities, counterparties, contacts, and lists. Maintain information about competitors and manage sales literature. Create quotes and convert them to orders and invoices. Create and view quick campaigns.
Access counterparties, contacts, and other business records
Counterparty Templates
Type OR between words. For example, type counterparties OR contacts.
Track potential sales with leads and opportunities. Keep info about companies in counterparties. Store info about people you do business with in contacts.
Have a company you want to add as a new counterparty? Meet a new contact? Create them quickly here.
Email messages from Dynamics 365 Leads, Contacts, and Counterparties

During synchronization, the parent counterparty of Microsoft Dynamics 365 contacts can be inserted or used to overwrite the names in the Company field of the Outlook contacts. Changes are not synchronized in Microsoft Dynamics 365.
Update Company fields with parent counterparty names
A product is an item in the product catalog that you want to sell to your counterparties.

Description.description: This is the account hierarchy definition.
